title: DSA Level 2 — Arrays, Two-Pointers & Frequency
concept: Slightly harder array problems: pairs, frequency counting, two-pointer tricks.

challenges.title: Second Largest Element
challenges.description: Given an array of N distinct integers (no duplicates), find the second largest element. If N < 2, print -1.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N distinct integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Single integer: second largest value, or -1 if not defined.

challenges.title: Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array
challenges.description: Given a sorted array of N integers, remove duplicates in-place such that each element appears only once, and print the resulting array.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers in non-decreasing order.
challenges.outputDescription: Array after deleting duplicates, in one line.

challenges.title: Count Distinct Elements
challenges.description: Given an array of N integers, count the number of distinct elements in the array.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Single integer: number of distinct values.

challenges.title: Pair Sum Exists
challenges.description: Given N, an array of N integers, and a target value S, determine if there exists a pair of distinct elements whose sum is S. Print "YES" if such a pair exists, otherwise "NO".
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers. Third line: S.

challenges.title: Two Sum Indices (Sorted Array)
challenges.description: Given a sorted array of N integers and a target S, find two indices i and j (1-based, i < j) such that a[i] + a[j] = S. If multiple answers, print any one pair. If none, print -1.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers in non-decreasing order. Third line: S.

challenges.title: Move Zeros to End
challenges.description: Given an array of N integers, move all zeros to the end while keeping the relative order of non-zero elements. Modify in-place and then print the array.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.
challenges.outputDescription: N integers after moving all zeros to the end.

challenges.title: Maximum Subarray Sum (Kadane’s Basics)
challenges.description: Given an array of N integers (can be negative), find the maximum possible sum of a contiguous subarray.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.

challenges.title: Frequency of Each Element (Sorted Output)
challenges.description: Given an array of N integers, print each distinct element and its frequency. Output should be sorted by the element value in increasing order.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.
challenges.outputDescription: For each distinct value v, print a separate line: v count.

challenges.title: Majority Element (More Than N/2 Times)
challenges.description: Given an array of N integers, determine if there is an element that appears more than N/2 times. If it exists, print that element; otherwise, print -1.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Second line: N integers.

challenges.title: Longest Subarray of Ones After Flipping K Zeros
challenges.description: Given a binary array (containing only 0s and 1s) of length N and an integer K, you are allowed to flip at most K zeros to ones. Find the length of the longest contiguous subarray that contains only ones after flips.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N K. Second line: N integers (0 or 1).
challenges.outputDescription: Single integer: maximum length of such subarray.
